newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan's King Hussein to make pilgrimage to Mecca.
newsitem.headline: Jordan's King Hussein to make pilgrimage to Mecca.

text.p: King Hussein of Jordan will fly to Saudi Arabia on Thursday on a pilgrimage to Mecca, a palace official said on Wednesday.

It was not clear if the king planned to meet Saudi Arabia's King Fahd during his visit, the official said. The two leaders put aside six years of bitterness last year when King Fahd met him for talks on Middle East peace efforts.

Jordan's ties with its oil-rich neighbour were strained in 1990 when King Hussein refused to join Saudi Arabia and other Arab and Western countries in a military coalition to recapture Kuwait from occupying Iraqi troops.
King Hussein, whose great-grandfather was ruler of Mecca until its capture by King Fahd's father King Abdul-Aziz in 1924, will perform the minor pilgrimage of Umra.
He is due to leave Jordan on Thursday after iftar, the dusk meal which marks the end of daylight fasting for Moslems in the holy month of Ramadan.
